alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Orange; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 10:26PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Orange, southern Caledonia and southeastern Washington Counties through 1130 PM EDT... At 1025 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brookfield, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Barre, St. Johnsbury, Waterford, Plainfield, Orange, Websterville, Marshfield Village, Topsham, Groton, Marshfield, Lower Waterford, Barre Town, Washington, Ryegate, Barre City, Barnet, Williamstown, Groton Village, Ricker State Park, and Peacham. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 34 and 46. Interstate 91 between mile markers 116 and 118, and between mile markers 120 and 132. Interstate 93 near mile marker 1, and between mile markers 9 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
